intro: Elaphrium integerrimum, commonly known as the roughleaf elaphrium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, rough-textured leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
